intro: Leeuwenhoeckia, commonly known as the "dwarf leeuwenhoeck," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or white. The plant is native to South Africa and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Leeuwenhoeckia species are popular in rock gardens due to their hardiness and ornamental value. They are also noted for their ability to thrive in full sun and well-drained conditions.
